Title: OOU SSANU, NASU protest cancellation of two-day off palliative
Summary: The Joint Action Committee of Senior Staff of Nigerian Universities and the Non-Academic Staff Union of Educational and Associated Institutions of Olabisi Onabanjo University, Ago Iwoye, protested against the cancellation of the two-day off given about a year ago .

Title: Africa projected to be fourth largest economy by 2050 – WTO
Summary: The World Trade Organisation has projected that Africa could emerge as the world’s fourth largest economy by 2050 if it harnesses its demographic and resource potential . WTO Director-General Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, in an interview with CNN, said that trading within the African continent is crucial .

Title: Tottenham supporting Udogie after alleged gun threat in London
Summary: Destiny Udogie was allegedly threatened with a gun in London in September . Police arrested a 31-year-old man in connection with the incident . Tottenham say they are supporting the Italian international and his family .

Title: Guardian journalists shine with multiple nominations at 19th NMNA
Summary: The Guardian has earned multiple nominations across categories at the 19th edition of the Nigeria Media Nite Out Awards . The annual event, which celebrates excellence and professionalism in journalism, celebrates excellence .

Title: Kidnapped Auchi seminarian dies as U.S. threatens action over christians attacks
Summary: Emmanuel Alabi was one of three students abducted from the Immaculate Conception Minor Seminary, Ivianokpodi, during an attack by armed men on July 10, 2025 . The diocese of Auchi confirmed the death of the seminarian .

Title: Kidnapped Edo minor seminarian confirmed dead
Summary: The seminarians were abducted on July 10, 2025, when armed men attacked the Immaculate Conception Minor Seminary in Ivianokpodi .

Title: Akwa Ibom Govt suspends village head for alleged terrorism
Summary: The Akwa Ibom Government has suspended the Village Head of Ikot Umo Essien, Chief Monday Esu, for alleged acts of terrorism . Chief Esu was in Essien Udim Local Government Area, for allegedly terrorism . The village head has been suspended for alleged terrorism .

Title: Dowman, Moukoko, Yamal, others – Ten youngest Champions League players
Summary: Max Dowman of Arsenal created history on Tuesday by being the first 15-year-old to participate in the UEFA Champions League . Dowman, Moukoko, Yamal, others – Ten youngest Champions League players .

Title: Alleged Terrorism: You’ve last chance to defend yourself, court tells Kanu
Summary: Federal High Court gives Nnamdi Kanu last chance to defend seven-count terrorism charge . Kanu was detained by the Federal Government on Wednesday . He is the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB .

Title: Troops rescue military officer, nine others in Benue
Summary: Troops rescue military officer, nine others from kidnappers in Benue State . Troops of Joint Task Force, Operation Whirl Stroke have rescued a military personnel and nine others .

Title: Musa Yar’adua varsity workers declare two-week warning strike
Summary: Joint congresses of the four in-house unions of Umaru Musa Yar’adua University, Katsina, have embarked on a two-week warning strike . The other unions are the Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities, National Association of Academic Technologists, and the Non-Academic Staff Union of Educational and Associated

Title: NIS to introduce emergency passport for Nigerians abroad
Summary: The Nigeria Immigration Service has announced plans to introduce a Single Travel Emergency Passport . The new biometric travel document is designed to help Nigerians abroad whose passports are expired, lost, or stolen return home securely and verifiably . The STEP will replace the current Emergency Travel Certificate (ETC) as part of NIS’s

Title: UNIJOS dental students protest against 10 years without graduation
Summary: Dozens of University of Jos dental students have taken to the streets to protest the non-accreditation of their dental courses . The students, on Wednesday, blocked the university gate at its Permanent site, singing solidarity songs and carrying placards with different inscriptions . They demanded that the management address their plight and provide a solution to their predicament .

Title: Nigeria to gain 1.7m working mothers with affordable childcare — Report
Summary: Nigeria could gain up to 1.7 million working mothers by 2030 if the country invests in affordable, quality childcare . This is according to new findings from Economist Impact’s Childcare Dividend Initiative . The report is supported by the William and Flora Hewlett Foundation and generated from a high-level forum alongside the G20

Title: Tinubu mourns ex-chief of staff Mohammed
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has mourned the death of Major General Abdullahi Mohammed Adangba (rtd.), a former Chief of Staff to Presidents Olusegun Obasanjo and Umaru Musa Yar’Adua . Mohammed, who hailed from Ilorin, Kwara State, died around 1
